segment.source: The Microsoft® Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) helps you determine whether the applications, devices, and computers in your organization are compatible with versions of the Windows® operating system.
segment.target: The Microsoft® Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) helps you determine whether the applications, devices, and computers in your organization are compatible with versions of the Windows® operating system.

segment.source: The Microsoft® Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) helps you determine whether the applications, devices, and computers in your organization are compatible with versions of the Windows® operating system.
segment.target: The Microsoft® Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) helps you determine whether the applications, devices, and computers in your organization are compatible with versions of the Windows® operating system.

segment.source: By using ACT, you can obtain compatibility information from Microsoft and software vendors, identify compatibility issues within your own organization, and share compatibility ratings with other ACT users.
segment.target: By using ACT, you can obtain compatibility information from Microsoft and software vendors, identify compatibility issues within your own organization, and share compatibility ratings with other ACT users.

segment.source: The tools in ACT help you analyze and mitigate compatibility issues before you deploy a version of Windows to your organization.
segment.target: The tools in ACT help you analyze and mitigate compatibility issues before you deploy a version of Windows to your organization.

segment.source: ACT is available in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10.
segment.target: ACT is available in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10.

segment.source: The Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) helps you determine whether the applications, devices, and computers in your organization are compatible with versions of the Windows® operating system.
segment.target: The Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) helps you determine whether the applications, devices, and computers in your organization are compatible with versions of the Windows® operating system.

segment.source: With ACT, you can obtain compatibility information from Microsoft and software vendors, identify compatibility issues within your own organization, and share compatibility ratings with other ACT users.
segment.target: With ACT, you can obtain compatibility information from Microsoft and software vendors, identify compatibility issues within your own organization, and share compatibility ratings with other ACT users.

segment.source: The tools in ACT help you analyze and mitigate compatibility issues before deploying a version of Windows to your organization.
segment.target: The tools in ACT help you analyze and mitigate compatibility issues before deploying a version of Windows to your organization.

segment.source: This section provides information about setting up the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) in your organization.
segment.target: This section provides information about setting up the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) in your organization.

segment.source: This section describes how to use the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) in your organization.
segment.target: This section describes how to use the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) in your organization.

segment.target: This section provides troubleshooting information for the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT).

segment.source: This section contains information about the user interface for Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), which is a tool in the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT).
segment.target: This section contains information about the user interface for Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), which is a tool in the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT).

segment.source: The following sections provide links to resources and reference material for the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT).
segment.target: The following sections provide links to resources and reference material for the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT).

segment.source: The following table lists terms and definitions used by the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT).
segment.target: The following table lists terms and definitions used by the Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT).

segment.source: Compatibility Fixes for Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, and Windows Vista
segment.target: Compatibility Fixes for Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, and Windows Vista

segment.source: You can fix some compatibility issues that are due to the changes made between Windows operating system versions.
segment.target: You can fix some compatibility issues that are due to the changes made between Windows operating system versions.

segment.source: These issues can include User Account Control (UAC) restrictions.
segment.target: These issues can include User Account Control (UAC) restrictions.
